When thou sittest<S>3427</S> to eat<S>3898</S> with a ruler<S>4910</S>, consider<S>995</S> diligently<S>995</S> what is before<S>6440</S> thee:
And put<S>7760</S> a knife<S>7915</S> to thy throat<S>3930</S>, if thou be a man given<S>1167</S> to appetite<S>5315</S>.
Be not desirous<S>183</S> of his dainties<S>4303</S>: for they are deceitful<S>3577</S> meat<S>3899</S>.
Labour<S>3021</S> not to be rich<S>6238</S>: cease<S>2308</S> from thine own wisdom<S>998</S>.
Wilt thou set<S>5774</S> <S>5774</S> thine eyes<S>5869</S> upon that which is not? for riches certainly<S>6213</S> make<S>6213</S> themselves wings<S>3671</S>; they fly away<S>5774</S> <S>5774</S> as an eagle<S>5404</S> toward heaven<S>8064</S>. <sup>set: Heb. cause thine eyes to fly upon</sup>
Eat<S>3898</S> thou not the bread<S>3899</S> of him that hath an evil<S>7451</S> eye<S>5869</S>, neither desire<S>183</S> thou his dainty meats<S>4303</S>:
For as he thinketh<S>8176</S> in his heart<S>5315</S>, so is he: Eat<S>398</S> and drink<S>8354</S>, saith<S>559</S> he to thee; but his heart<S>3820</S> is not with thee.
The morsel<S>6595</S> which thou hast eaten<S>398</S> shalt thou vomit up<S>6958</S>, and lose<S>7843</S> thy sweet<S>5273</S> words<S>1697</S>.
Speak<S>1696</S> not in the ears<S>241</S> of a fool<S>3684</S>: for he will despise<S>936</S> the wisdom<S>7922</S> of thy words<S>4405</S>.
Remove<S>5253</S> not the old<S>5769</S> landmark<S>1366</S>; and enter<S>935</S> not into the fields<S>7704</S> of the fatherless<S>3490</S>: <sup>landmark: or, bound</sup>
For their redeemer<S>1350</S> is mighty<S>2389</S>; he shall plead<S>7378</S> their cause<S>7379</S> with thee.
Apply<S>935</S> thine heart<S>3820</S> unto instruction<S>4148</S>, and thine ears<S>241</S> to the words<S>561</S> of knowledge<S>1847</S>.
Withhold<S>4513</S> not correction<S>4148</S> from the child<S>5288</S>: for if thou beatest<S>5221</S> him with the rod<S>7626</S>, he shall not die<S>4191</S>.
Thou shalt beat<S>5221</S> him with the rod<S>7626</S>, and shalt deliver<S>5337</S> his soul<S>5315</S> from hell<S>7585</S>.
My son<S>1121</S>, if thine heart<S>3820</S> be wise<S>2449</S>, my heart<S>3820</S> shall rejoice<S>8055</S>, even mine<S>589</S>. <sup>even: or, even I will rejoice</sup>
Yea, my reins<S>3629</S> shall rejoice<S>5937</S>, when thy lips<S>8193</S> speak<S>1696</S> right things<S>4339</S>.
Let not thine heart<S>3820</S> envy<S>7065</S> sinners<S>2400</S>: but be thou in the fear<S>3374</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> all the day<S>3117</S> long.
For surely there is<S>3426</S> an end<S>319</S>; and thine expectation<S>8615</S> shall not be cut off<S>3772</S>. <sup>end: or, reward</sup>
Hear<S>8085</S> thou, my son<S>1121</S>, and be wise<S>2449</S>, and guide<S>833</S> thine heart<S>3820</S> in the way<S>1870</S>.
Be not among winebibbers<S>3196</S> <S>5433</S>; among riotous eaters<S>2151</S> of flesh<S>1320</S>: <sup>of flesh: Heb. of their flesh</sup>
For the drunkard<S>5433</S> and the glutton<S>2151</S> shall come to poverty<S>3423</S>: and drowsiness<S>5124</S> shall clothe<S>3847</S> a man with rags<S>7168</S>.
Hearken<S>8085</S> unto thy father<S>1</S> that begat<S>3205</S> thee, and despise<S>936</S> not thy mother<S>517</S> when she is old<S>2204</S>.
Buy<S>7069</S> the truth<S>571</S>, and sell<S>4376</S> it not; also wisdom<S>2451</S>, and instruction<S>4148</S>, and understanding<S>998</S>.
The father<S>1</S> of the righteous<S>6662</S> shall greatly<S>1524</S> rejoice<S>1523</S>: and he that begetteth<S>3205</S> a wise<S>2450</S> child shall have joy<S>8055</S> of him.
Thy father<S>1</S> and thy mother<S>517</S> shall be glad<S>8055</S>, and she that bare<S>3205</S> thee shall rejoice<S>1523</S>.
My son<S>1121</S>, give<S>5414</S> me thine heart<S>3820</S>, and let thine eyes<S>5869</S> observe<S>7521</S> <S>5341</S> my ways<S>1870</S>.
For a whore<S>2181</S> is a deep<S>6013</S> ditch<S>7745</S>; and a strange woman<S>5237</S> is a narrow<S>6862</S> pit<S>875</S>.
She also lieth in wait<S>693</S> as for a prey<S>2863</S>, and increaseth<S>3254</S> the transgressors<S>898</S> among men<S>120</S>. <sup>as for: or, as a robber</sup>
Who hath woe<S>188</S>? who hath sorrow<S>17</S>? who hath contentions<S>4079</S> <S>4066</S>? who hath babbling<S>7879</S>? who hath wounds<S>6482</S> without cause<S>2600</S>? who hath redness<S>2448</S> of eyes<S>5869</S>?
They that tarry long<S>309</S> at the wine<S>3196</S>; they that go<S>935</S> to seek<S>2713</S> mixed wine<S>4469</S>.
Look<S>7200</S> not thou upon the wine<S>3196</S> when it is red<S>119</S>, when it giveth<S>5414</S> his colour<S>5869</S> in the cup<S>3563</S> <S>3599</S>, when it moveth<S>1980</S> itself aright<S>4339</S>.
At the last<S>319</S> it biteth<S>5391</S> like a serpent<S>5175</S>, and stingeth<S>6567</S> like an adder<S>6848</S>. <sup>an: or, a cockatrice</sup>
Thine eyes<S>5869</S> shall behold<S>7200</S> strange women<S>2114</S>, and thine heart<S>3820</S> shall utter<S>1696</S> perverse things<S>8419</S>.
Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down<S>7901</S> in the midst<S>3820</S> of the sea<S>3220</S>, or as he that lieth<S>7901</S> upon the top<S>7218</S> of a mast<S>2260</S>. <sup>the midst: Heb. the heart of the sea</sup>
They have stricken<S>5221</S> me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick<S>2470</S>; they have beaten<S>1986</S> me, and I felt<S>3045</S> it not: when shall I awake<S>6974</S>? I will seek<S>1245</S> it yet<S>3254</S> again. <sup>I felt: Heb. I knew it not</sup>
